fullText: Bobby Cannavale brings a compelling vulnerability to his portrayal of Charlie Castle, the Hollywood star trapped in a corrupt system, while the supporting cast delivers uniformly strong performances in this revival of Clifford Odets' caustic 1949 drama.
dtliExcerpt: Bobby Cannavale brings a compelling vulnerability to his portrayal of Charlie Castle, the Hollywood star trapped in a corrupt system, while the supporting cast delivers uniformly strong performances in this revival of Clifford Odets' caustic 1949 drama.
bwwExcerpt: While its preachy lack of subtlety makes this drama ultimately less corrosive or shattering than the tragic events that unfold onstage might have been, it's still fascinating theater, even with imperfectly cast leads. What Doug Hughes' Broadway revival for Roundabout Theatre Company does have in its...
